Reviews.Title: “Clean, big rooms but far from city”
Reviews.Author: AlleyCe
Reviews.Content: The rooms are massive by European standards, but the bathrooms are small. The bed was nice. The staff was very friendly. My only complaint is that it is verrrry far from the city. About €20 by can or 30min by metro.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a make over!”
Reviews.Author: Iliveforholidays88
Reviews.Content: This hotel feels like its in a dodgy area! The room was really small and we couldnt work out how to get the air conditioning working for ages. The carpet and decor was really old.The double bed was pressed up against the wall and the other side next to the door so no bedside tables could fit. The bathroom was so small the shower was very old. The hallways to the hotel werent bad and were clean. The breakfast was good here too quite a good selection of food especially cake!

Reviews.Title: “Saved from Embarrasment”
Reviews.Author: lisa a
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Beethoven for 3 nights approximately 1 year ago, as our last stop on a cross Europe adventure. First, it was nice and clean and the staff were friendly. The shower was a typical 3 star Europe hotel shower, it was OK. The room was very small and not much space to move around once you add 2 backpacks to the mix. However, the bed was comfortable and clean. Also, the underground made travelling around easy and quick and the buses were plenty. It was the housekeeping staff that were particularly wonderful. My partner and I washed a select few underclothes in the bathroom sink the night we arrived. It had to be done! We had a large deck and it was very warm, so we layed everything out. We got up early and took off for a full day of exploration in Rome. By days end, the wind picked up and we realized we forgot to collect our clothes off the deck and that they that had probably blown all over, including the court yard below. I was mortified at the thought of my underwear in someones back yard, but that particular housekeeper saved me from embarrassment. We returned to our room and there, all our clothes were neatly folded and laying on our bed. If he or she reads this.....THANK YOU!!

Reviews.Title: “General 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeTurner11
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in reasonable location, have to catch bus and train into town. Bacon and eggs for breakfast which is a refreshing change from ham and cheese

Reviews.Title: “It's not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: kiwideni
Reviews.Content: Ok so the location isn't great, it seems like a dodgy part of town...however our room was great! Wish I had bothered to take photos because it seems our room was the complete opposite of most of the rooms reviewed on here. Our room and bathroom were clean and tidy and we even had a balcony...couldn't fault the room at all, sure it's not 5 star but it's definitely not the worst place we stayed at on our trip through Europe There is a bus stop next to the intersection closest to the hotel that will take you all the way to the Vatican and it's only about a 10 minute ride, the metro is also close by but they were on strike the day that day... We only stayed here for one night as we had pre-booked a different hotel in the centre of the city but I didn't really mind this place.

Reviews.Title: “rather shabby”
Reviews.Author: watersteeg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during a weeks trip to Rome. Is is in a more or less residential area where ther is nit much to do. Hotel offers breakfast, thats it. No pleasure staying at the bar. Rooms small. Ours took some physical skills to use the bathroom. Balcony: yes. It is only 5 -10 minut trip with bus to nearest metro stop. There are also restaurants there. Walking at night back to hotel from metro is possible. Use this hotel as a moderate sleeping location, as you will in town all day, have dinner in town. The area itself is ok and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, dirty and terrible location”
Reviews.Author: rsea1978
Reviews.Content: We had the unfortunate experience of staying 3 nights at this horrific establishment as part of a tour, after which time I was almost ready to cancel our tour completely and travel independently. The hotel is located in what can only be described as a ghetto with no decent food or shops within a significant distance. The rooms stunk, were cramped and without air conditioning. All day and night you are disturbed by sirens from passing emergency vehicles. To make matters worse the staff are possibly the most unhelpful I've ever experienced, anywhere. The wireless internet system does not work at all and there are no internet cafes within walking distance. We have made alternative arrangements at the end of our tour despite having already paid for a night as part of our tour. I suggest making alternative arrangements if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way for something average”
Reviews.Author: Molokov
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights at the start of my tour - it's so far to get here, almost to the end of one metro line *and then* a bus... Hardly anything around nearby to go and eat (and it's all shut on a Sunday) and the suburb is very dodgy. Hotel rooms are OK, but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “poor aircon, disgusting food, no internet, thieving staff”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMay
Reviews.Content: stayed here with a tour group, our a/c would make a "knocking" noise when turning up to high speed. house keeping staff had stolen a few personal items from drawers, at the end of our tour group's last day, 1 of our fellow travellers had their bag stolen from the lobby. we highly suspected the concierge. Do not ever stay here, it is not located in a safe area, there are no restaurants or bars surrounding it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother staying here”
Reviews.Author: RevellingAround
Reviews.Content: PROS: - I cannot think of anything positive to say about this hotel CONS: - located a bus and train ride from the centre of Rome - the carpet in the room was filthy - the room was incredibly hot...no air con...the best reception could recommend was sleeping with the window open - we stayed here with a tour group and reception didn't seem to be able to cope with the room requirements - a couple got a quad share room, yet the people requiring a triple were told there were none and they had to split up

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel, out of the centre though”
Reviews.Author: snad1611
Reviews.Content: Pros: clean, cheap, breakfast, staff very nice, rooms spacious with balcony to dry clothes easily Cons: Bathroom floods with showers, as poor drainage and showers curtain doesn't work, quite a bit out of the centre, have to catch a bus to get to train station or taxi, and then 5-10 min to centre of rome I have to say I would probably get a hotel closer to centre of rome, as was a nightmare to find!!! However, was very nice hotel with all other things considered.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, far location, poor staff and not recomendable”
Reviews.Author: mas62
Reviews.Content: " I was in this hotel recently and it was my worst experience during my vacations to Rome. When arriving at Termini station there is no bus or metro that will take you straight to the hotel. It was about half an hour to 45 minutes away from the touristic center of Rome. The rooms were tiny and the house keeping was not the best that can be, and to me sanitation matters most. Another terrible part was that the breakfast was extremely poor. It was from 7 to 10 AM and the first morning at the hotel we went down to eat at 8:30 AM and there was nothing there. The staff was not a nice as can be either. They were rude and seemed like they did not enjoy having their guests stay there. The hotel is mostly used by big tours from other countries, especially with teenagers which tend to be loud and inconsiderate. One night the smoke alarms woke us all up at midnight because somebody was smoking in one of the rooms. Also it seemed like the walls were made out of paper because we could hear what the other guests were doing. This startled many of us. I definitely do not recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Far from Center, unhelpfull indifferrent stuff”
Reviews.Author: Matiola
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed 4 nights in this hotel in December 2008, right before New Year.Hotel is located pretty far from center, in unglamorous working neighborhood. You need to take subway almost to the end of the line, then take one of 3 buses. One bus indeed stops in front of hotel, but we never seen that one. Other two buses: you really need to show driver hotel name and ask him to stop close by, otherwise you will be lost. We were lost even on our third day of stay! The stuff was indifferrently unhelpful when we asked regular tourist questions. One evening there were no hot water. One morning when we had to leave earlier for a trip out of town and wanted to grab a sandwich: breakfast was already placed on tables, we were screamed at: we were not allowed to take anything before 7am (we were there at 6:45am!) because their rule says breakfast starts at 7! Room was very, very small although it was not as important as ability to take a hot shower at evening... I would not advice anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel off the beaten track!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ellegirl119
Reviews.Content: When arriving at the hotel I was pretty sure that I was going to hate the hotel, but was I wrong! The photos that can be found online are completely outdated so disregard all of them. The hotel was cute and the staff was very helpful and really cared about the quality of your stay. When you first walk in their is a cute and fairly updated lobby where a hotel employee can always be found. We had a triple room and we were surprised with how much room we had!! The room was nice with a large bathroom and a nice large window which could be opened to the street. There wasn't much noise either. For those depending on the breakfast I would say make sure you pack some extra snacks. The breakfast is not very fulfilling but I guess it works for young adults who just don't care!!! There is also a bus stop which is located right outside of the hotel gates which allows for easy transportation to all of the major sites in Rome!!! It was really nice to spend the whole day in the city and then be dropped off right in front of the hotel!! Overall, I would say that this is a great hotel for anyone interested in going to Rome and wants to stay outside of the crazy traffic!!

Reviews.Title: “a nce hotel in rome, away from the jungle traffic”
Reviews.Author: ioanina
Reviews.Content: We've stayed for one night at the end of September. There were 4 of us, two couple. The reception personell was very helpfull and the assistance received was great. The rooms and bathroom are very clean, with nice furniture and co-ordinated colours. It is a hotel above the average of Rome hotels. Althought it far from the center it is very well connected thrpough public transport. Get of at ornelia M1 station and take the bus 49 that leaves you right in the front of the hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Beethoven
HotelInfo.Address: Via Forte Braschi 2, 00167 Rome, Italy
